BlogProjects Uses Photos

What I Use #

Below is a list of all the equipment and tools I use on a daily basis. This list is updated regularly.

Devices #

  • Macbook Pro 14" — Just love it. M4 pro 14 core CPU, 20 core GPU, 48 GB RAM, 3 TB SSD.
  • Asus TUF F15 (15", 2021) — The TUF is just amazing. Plus, 16 GB RAM.
  • Logitech G502 HERO — Customizable weights, multiple programmable buttons, continuous scrolling.
  • Logitech G402 — Backup mouse.
  • Dell UltraSharp 40 Curved Thunderbolt™ Hub Monitor - U4025QW — Actually size matters.
  • Samsung 27 Inch Monitor
  • Logitech G512 Blue Mechanical Keyboard — Nothing fancy over here, just a table that fits my office.
  • Cosmic Byte CB-GK-16 Blue Mechanical Keyboard — Backup keyboard.
  • Shure MV7+ — My first choice for smoothness.
  • RODE PSA1 arm — Keep quiet on motion.
  • Airpods PRO 2
  • Echo Dot — Average speaker, not recommended.
  • Ergonomic Chair — I sit all day, so I might as well get a good chair.
  • Tukzer Large Mouse Pad — Smooth tasks with smooth flows.
  • iPhone 16 Pro Max - I use this for work.
  • Poco X4 Pro with Customized Android - I use this for experimental & personal uses.
  • Trebleet Thunderbolt 5 Enclosure - World’s fastest up to 80 Gbps transfer rate.

You guys contact me for these #

  • Custom standing desk
  • Custom 20 power point metal strip
  • Custom Cable management metal box

Coding #

  • VSCode — After using Sublime for many years, I moved to VSCode like everybody else.
  • Vitesse Theme — This is the theme I created, maintain, and proudly use everywhere.
  • Fira Code — I absolutely love this monospaced font because of all the ligatures.

Terminal #

  • Hyper — Performance could be better, but I enjoy using this since it’s made with JavaScript.
  • NuShell — A new type of shell
  • Oh My ZSH — A collection of ZSH plugins that you install once and you’re ready to go.
  • Termius — SSH | SFTP | Port Forwarding | with a lot of features

Apps #

  • 1Password — The first thing I install on any new device.
  • KeePassXC — Best Open Source Password Manager (I was using it before 1Password), must recommend if you don’t want to spend money on premium password managers.
  • ShareX — This is what I use whenever I need to share and/or highlight screenshots (for Windows).
  • Directory Opus — Kills frustration of Windows Explorer limitations (for Windows).
  • PowerToys — Extra cheese on Windows.
  • Figma — I never thought something would replace the Adobe suite for me. Figma did.
  • Grammarly — A must-have tool for non-native English speakers like me.
  • Matrix & mautrix bridges — Open Network decentralised communication.
  • Beeper — All chats in one app.
  • Mattermost — The secure collaboration hub for technical teams.
  • Notion — My personal OS with all the notes from all my projects.
  • DevKinsta — Local Wordpress inside Docker Container
  • Obsidian — My current choice for to-do lists and organizing notes.
  • 1.1.1.1 — Fast. Free. Private. Proxy/VPN.
  • Rambox — Workspace simplifier.
  • Zen Browser — Best browser ever.
  • WSL — Windows Subsystem for Linux.
  • Spotify — I love music.
  • Voicemeeter — Audio mixer, but I use it to get multiple audio outputs (for Windows).
  • Espanso — It make keyboard more then just a keyboard.
  • Balena Etcher — Flash OS images to SD cards & USB drives, safely and easily.
  • WebTorrent — Streaming torrent client.
  • Self-hosted Wireguard — VPN over the internet.

Services #

  • Cloudflare — The DNS service I use with all my domains. Amazing product.
  • Firebase — A no-brainer database and auth solution for side projects.
  • Namecheap Domains — I buy and renew all my domains here.
  • Infisical — An open-source secrets manager for developers.
  • YesbhautikX Cloud — Here is where I host all my websites.
  • Amazon Web Services - AWS
  • Microsoft Azure & AI Studio
  • Oracle Cloud
  • OpenAI APIs

Screen Share | Record | Design | Edit #

  • OBS — Free and open source software for video recording and live streaming.
  • RustDesk — Open source virtual KVM software.
  • Filmora — Quick and easy video editor.
  • Canva — Create stunning designs.
  • Adobe Suite — I use Adobe Illustrator, after effects, premiere pro, and photoshop.

Audio #

  • OnePlus Buds 2 — By far the best headphones I ever had. Premium quality, solid build.
  • Redgear Cosmo 7.1 Surround Sound — All rounder rough and tough headset.

Finance #

  • Gmgn — Good night sleep, good morning money.
  • Binance
  • pump.fun
